alert.note: Alert for Allegan; Barry; Kalamazoo; Kent; Lake; Mason; Mecosta; Muskegon; Newaygo; Oceana; Osceola; Ottawa; Van Buren (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 18 at 11:24PM EST until February 19 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Portions of central and west central Michigan. * WHEN...Until 10 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions and poor visibility in a combination of snow and blowing snow tonight into Saturday morning. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The snow is expected to continue, locally heavy at times until around 1 am this morning. Once the frontal band snow showers move out, lake effect snow showers will develop and continue into mid morning Saturday. The gusty winds overnight will result if occasional whiteout conditions making driving treacherous during the early morning hours of Saturday. The heaviest accumulations will be north of Grand Rapids, inland of the lake shore, where 3 to 4 inches of snow is expected. For the area from Grand Rapids south expect 1 to 2 inches of snow overnight. The strong winds will create considerable blowing and drifting snow.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.

area.areaDesc: Allegan; Barry; Kalamazoo; Kent; Lake; Mason; Mecosta; Muskegon; Newaygo; Oceana; Osceola; Ottawa; Van Buren
